meanings.definition: One or the other of two options
meanings.sent1: I can't decide between either option.
meanings.sent2: You can choose either the red or the blue shirt.
meanings.sent3: I asked for either ice cream flavor, but they gave me both!
meanings.sent4: The treasure map led to either a chest of gold or a chest of jewels.
meanings.sent5: In the game, you must pick either the sword or the shield to continue.

meanings.definition: Used before the first of two or more alternatives
meanings.sent1: I can't find either book on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: You can have either apple for a snack.
meanings.sent3: I need either hand to hold the umbrella in this wind!
meanings.sent4: The magician will pull a rabbit out of either hat.
meanings.sent5: You can wear either shoe to the party; they both match your outfit.

meanings.definition: Used before the second of two alternatives
meanings.sent1: You can have tea or coffee, but not either.
meanings.sent2: She can either walk to the park or ride her bike.
meanings.sent3: I can either study for the test or watch a movie.
meanings.sent4: The cat will sleep either on the bed or on the couch.
meanings.sent5: You can either swim in the pool or play basketball in the yard.

meanings.definition: Used to introduce a statement that contrasts with a previous statement
meanings.sent1: I don't like coffee; either way, I prefer tea.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to go out; either she was tired or not feeling well.
meanings.sent3: I thought it was a good idea; either way, I was wrong.
meanings.sent4: He said he would come early; either he forgot or got stuck in traffic.
meanings.sent5: The movie was either too long or too boring for my taste.
